summary: Multi-Ticket (Cuentas Paralelas) feature testing completed successfully. All 6 test cases PASSED. The feature allows managing multiple rental tickets simultaneously like supermarket checkouts.

test_results.test_1_ticket_tabs_visible: PASS - Ticket tabs bar visible at top with data-testid='ticket-tabs'
test_results.test_2_create_new_ticket: PASS - New ticket created successfully using '+' button (data-testid='add-ticket-btn')
test_results.test_3_switch_between_tickets: PASS - Can switch between tickets by clicking tabs (data-testid='ticket-tab-N')
test_results.test_4_prueba_de_fuego_state_isolation: PASS - Added J011 to Ticket 1, BOOTS item to Ticket 2, switching back preserved J011 in Ticket 1
test_results.test_5_close_ticket_x_button: PASS - Close button (X) visible on tabs, successfully closed ticket (data-testid='close-ticket-N')
test_results.test_6_persistence_after_reload: PASS - Item (J014 - Salomon X-Max) persisted after page reload via localStorage

features_verified: Ticket tabs bar visible in upper part of NewRental page
Create new ticket with '+' button - adds new tab
Switch between tickets by clicking on tabs
State isolation: each ticket has its own items, customer, dates
Close ticket with 'X' button on tab
Badge count shows items in each ticket
critical_code_review_comments: useMultiTicketPersistence hook correctly manages isolated state per ticket
LocalStorage persistence with 24-hour expiration is working
data-testid attributes correctly implemented for all interactive elements
seed_data_used: Existing inventory items - J011 (Flow Brand 1 Flow Model 1), BC-SKI-190642 (J014 Salomon X-Max)
context_for_next_testing_agent: Multi-ticket feature is fully implemented and working. Test with data-testid selectors: ticket-tabs, ticket-tab-N, add-ticket-btn, close-ticket-N, barcode-input. The hook useMultiTicketPersistence.js manages state isolation between tickets. Tickets persist in localStorage for 24 hours per user.
